snippet: The study, conducted over three years in 40 states, is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.
abstract: Study published in journal Pediatrics finds a strong link between lower rates of adolescent obesity and strict laws regulating the sale of snacks and sugary drinks in public schools; conducted over three years in 40 states, study is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.
lead_paragraph: The study, conducted over three years in 40 states, is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.

headline.seo: Study Links Healthy Weight in Children With Tough Snack Laws
headline.main: Study Links Healthier Weight in Children With Strict Laws on School Snacks
headline.print_headline: Study Links Healthier Weight in Children With Strict Laws on School Snacks
